title.narrative: Cash assistance in response to rising food insecurity

description.narrative: The food security situation in South Sudan remains worrying. The drivers of food insecurity are due to the impact of the floods that affected close to a million people mainly along the Nile river that has affected harvests; the conflict that has affected access to livelihoods and is expected to continue during the dry season; the macro-economic conditions in the country; the high food prices; and the recurring high food insecurity over the years leading to asset stripping and negative coping mechanisms. For this CERF allocation, WFP will use unrestricted cash to respond to rising food insecurity to allow affected people to meet their food needs. The cash assistance from this CERF funding will be prioritised for households with a high risk to food, nutrition and protection-related vulnerabilities, including (but not limited to) female-headed households, households headed by persons with disabilities and child-headed households. The assistance will support alleviation of immediate food needs for 153,969 people. WFP will respond with in-kind assistance using funds from other donors to cover immediate food needs, where cash assistance is not possible. This project is part of an $80 million CERF allocation to support cash programming in response to increasing food insecurity in 6 countries.
